channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2025050466
item.description:
Report E-2025050466

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 22, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1993 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and two (2) pallets. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Valley Environmental Response (VER) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer. The crew also broke down the two (2) impacted pallets for disposal. Two (2) UN1993-impacted pallets, all granular absorbents, debris, and PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) cubic yard box. One (1) empty 5-gallon pail of UN1993 was collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025051547
item.description:
Report X-2025051547

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-20
  • City: GREEN BAY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Holly Thede, Operations Supervisor, called Safety to report a spill in trailer 570508 involving UN3378, Sodium Carbonate Peroxyhydrate, Class 5.1, Packing Group II. Holly stated that the substance appeared to be a white powder located on top of the lids of the pails. She mentioned that she could not see any visible damage to the pails, as they were wrapped in plastic. However, it appeared that some of the lids had shifted, causing a few to become loose or pop off. Holly estimated that the pails were approximately 55 lbs each, and that there was about 8 ounces of the white powder on the lids.~~ CURA was called to assist with the spill in the trailer.

item.title: Report E-2025050293
item.description:
Report E-2025050293

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-19
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0351 EDT on 4/19, XPO-XTM contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 pounds of Potassium Perchlorate from two 50lb plastic bags onto the trailer floor. The bags were improperly loaded and damaged from BCH. The material is a class 5.1 and ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-pounds of UN1489 Potassium Perchlorate released to a 6’x6’ wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The crew containerized the (2) bags of product into (1) 55-gallon poly drum/vented and (1) 55-gallon poly drum containing impacted PPE/wetted. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
